result.execSummary:
The defendant William H. Perrin Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
May serve in the WSP.
Concurrent with: any sentence(s) currently serving

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 1:30 PM Defendant William H. Perrin Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for William H. Perrin Jr.  Attorney Zachary P Leigh in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to in person appearance at disposition; defendant wishes to waive right, colloquy given and knowing waiver accepted.  State recites joint recommendation:  amend to Misd BJ:  30 days jail, concurrent to any sentence(s) currently serving; $463 cost.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation. Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
